item.title: Once Human: How to Prepare for Season Reset
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Base-related Tasks
  • Shop-related Tasks
  • Exploration-related Tasks
  • Eternaland-related Tasks

Once Human features a seasonal system, where each season introduces an exciting new ‘Scenario’. A Scenario lasts six weeks and brings fresh content to the game, including unique challenges, missions, and storylines. After six weeks, the game undergoes a season reset, wiping out almost all of your exploration progress.

Even though the thought of starting over sounds dreadful, a season reset gives you the chance to experience Once Human in a new way. Preparing for a season reset beforehand can help you get a headstart on the new season and avoid any setbacks. This guide covers a list of things you can do before a season resets in Once Human to ensure a smoother transition.

Base-related Tasks

Considering that your base is the only safe space in Once Human where you can rest, store items, and build structures, here are some essential tasks to complete before a season reset:

  • Save your base as a blueprint
  • Buy furniture blueprints from vendors
  • Complete weekly purifications, ideally using level 3 cortexes
  • Disassemble extra calibration blueprints to get Stardust Source
  • Disassemble dropped weapons for resources

If you have used materials in your base that are not yet available in the new season (like Gravel for Stone structures), they will automatically be substituted with lower-tier materials (like Wood) when you rebuild using the saved base blueprint.

Shop-related Tasks

Thankfully, certain resources and items can be carried over across seasons. This includes all important currencies, limited-time cosmetics, expressions and poses, namecards, and more. As such, here’s a list of shop-related activities you can do to prepare for the season reset:

  • Stockpile currencies like Starchroms, Stellar Planula, Crystgins, Mitsuko's Marks, and Sproutlets.
  • Save up to 390,000 Energy Links to buy all Starchrom Crates in the Season Shop.
  • Purchase weekly Controllers from the Warband Shop.
  • Purchase all available Cosmetics with non-paid currencies.
  • Purchase all limited-time items from the Shop.

Exploration-related Tasks

If you’re a completionist or just someone who wants to get the most out of their current scenario before the season reset, make sure to finish these tasks before the next season:

  • Complete all Journeys.
  • Complete all season goals.
  • Complete all Prime Wars in Once Human at least once for Starchrom reward.
  • Unlock all Mystical crates.
  • Unlock all Morphic crates.
  • Get all the food recipes.
  • Use all permits at workshop defenses.
  • Stockpile Acid as much as you can.
  • Acquire all weapon mods and attachments you need/want.
  • Collect gear blueprints and blueprint fragments.

Eternaland-related Tasks

Eternaland is a special bubble world in Once Human that remains untouched during seasonal resets. Some items, like weapons, armor, medicines, and ammo, will automatically be sent to your Eternaland Spacetime Backpack when the season ends. At the start of the new season, you can use Material Points to transfer items from your Eternaland Depot to your regular backpack.

Before a season reset, make sure to:

  • Store all existing furniture items in Eternaland.
  • Turn all extra, lower-level deviations into Astral Sand currency, used for construction.

item.title: 10 Mario Games That Are On The Most Consoles
item.description:
Arguably the face of video games as a medium, nearly all Mario titles have become instant classics almost as soon as they have been released. As a result, many Mario titles have been ported to a multitude of varied home consoles and handheld systems.

From many titles' arcade origins, multiple Mario games have even been brought to non-Nintendo platforms by producers such as Atari. Beyond this, some classic Mario games are even playable within titles such as Animal Crossing and Donkey Kong 64.

10 Mario Golf

A Classic Mario Sports Title With A Home Console & Handheld Dual Release

With a dual release by Camelot Software, Mario Golf saw the Mario-themed sports title being brought to the Nintendo 64 and the Game Boy Color.

Since its initial 1999 release, Mario Golf has been playable through Nintendo's own digital storefronts on multiple generations of home and handheld consoles. Most recently, both the Game Boy Color and Nintendo 64 versions of Mario Golf have been made available on the Nintendo Switch hybrid console through Nintendo's own Nintendo Switch Online classic game catalog.

9 Wrecking Crew

An Arcade Classic From Mario's Pre-Mushroom Kingdom Days

  • Released: July 26, 1984
  • Developer(s): Nintendo R&D1
  • Genre: Arcade, Action, Puzzle

Designed by Yoshio Sakamoto - well known for his directorial work on Metroid - in a twist compared to his now-typical moveset, Mario cannot jump in Wrecking Crew and instead has to work through various stages destroying objects with his oversized hammer.

While Wrecking Crew initially saw release in the arcades, it was quickly ported to the NES and has since been brought to multiple Nintendo home and handheld consoles through Nintendo's digital storefronts. Most recently, Wrecking Crew 's NES port has been made available for the Nintendo Switch through its NSO subscription service.

8 Dr. Mario

Not Only A Classic Mario Spin-Off But A Quintessential Puzzle Title

  • Released: July 27, 1990
  • Developer(s): Nintendo R&D1
  • Genre: Puzzle

Produced by Gunpei Yokoi, creator of the Game & Watch and Game Boy, this Mario -themed falling-block puzzle series has seen lasting success across platforms with its most recent title releasing on mobile devices in 2019.

Initially launching on the NES and Game Boy in 1990, Dr. Mario has since gone on to be ported through Nintendo's digital storefronts and dedicated collections. The Classic NES Series on the Game Boy Advance brought Dr. Mario to the sixth console generation, and it is now available not only on Wii, WiiU, and 3DS but also on Nintendo Switch through Nintendo's own Nintendo Switch Online program.

7 Super Mario World

An SNES Launch Title Ported To Handhelds And Consoles Alike

First finding footing as a launch title for the SNES in 1990, Super Mario World was then re-released on the console as part of the compilation Super Mario All-Stars + Super Mario World.

Since then, it has gone on to be brought to Nintendo's Game Boy Advance handheld through its inclusion in the Mario Advance series of ports. Nintendo's digital storefront has consistently presented Super Mario World , and it was then made available on Nintendo's plug-and-play console, the SNES Mini. Its most recent port has been to the Nintendo Switch through Nintendo's own NSO library. ​​​​

6 Super Mario Bros. 3

Arguably The Quintessential 2D Mario Platformer, Available Across Generations

Introducing many Mario series staples; such as the Tanooki suit, a world map, and the Koopalings; Super Mario Bros. 3 has been regularly brought to multiple Nintendo consoles.

Initially launched on the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1988, it was then ported to the SNES through the remaster compilation Super Mario All-Stars . In the age of digital storefronts, Nintendo has made Super Mario Bros. 3 available on all available Nintendo consoles; from the Wii and WiiU to the 3DS family of systems.

5 Super Mario Bros. 2

A Classic Re-Skin That Has Been Ported Time And Time Again

While not the original design for Super Mario Bros' sequel, the North American and European version of Super Mario Bros. 2 has since become a staple of the Mario series' history.

The Doki Doki Panic aesthetic alteration was initially brought to the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1988 and was subsequently ported to the SNES. This remastered version was the core of the version that was ported to the Game Boy Advance, and the original title has since been brought to Nintendo's digital storefronts. Being preloaded on Nintendo's NES Classic plug-and-play system, Super Mario Bros. 2 is now also available through Nintendo's Nintendo Switch Online virtual library of titles.

4 Super Mario Bros.

The Classic NES Mario Title, Playable Across Nintendo Platforms

Perhaps due to Super Mario Bros .' unrivaled legacy, Nintendo brought Mario's quintessential platforming caper to arcades, handhelds, and a variety of Nintendo home consoles. Beyond these, a playable version of Super Mario Bros. has also been hidden within the original Animal Crossing as an item for players to spruce up their living space with.

Releasing alongside the NES in North America in 1985, the title was also included in the SNES Super Mario All-Stars remaster collection. Super Mario Bros. has also been brought to handheld consoles such as the Game Boy and 3DS family of systems alongside its inclusion in Nintendo's NES Classic plug-and-play system.

3 Donkey Kong Jr.

Mario Takes The Enemy Role In This Much-Ported Arcade Sequel

As a direct sequel to the title with Mario's first appearance - Donkey Kong - Donkey Kong Jr. includes Mario in an antagonistic role.

Originally playable in arcades in 1982, Donkey Kong Junior was quickly ported to multiple Atari systems, before it found a place in the NES' home console library. It has also gone on to be hidden in the original Animal Crossing and is playable through scanning related Game Boy Advance E-Reader cards. Beyond these more obscure instances, Donkey Kong Junior has also been available through its original arcade and NES versions on the Nintendo Switch hybrid system.

2 Mario Bros.

Mario And Luigi Star In Their Own Title Before They Became 'Super'

Originally a simple spin-off from Mario's first appearance in Donkey Kong , Mario Bros. was initially released as an arcade title.

Since its 1983 debut, it has since gone on to be ported to multiple Nintendo home and handheld consoles - be it through a direct port, or its inclusion as a bonus title. However, in its earliest years, Mario Bros. was ported to multiple other systems; from Atari's home consoles to the ZX Spectrum. Its original arcade version can be played through its Arcade Archives release on the Nintendo Switch, or through the NES version available in the Nintendo Switch Online digital library.

1 Donkey Kong

Mario's Debut Title That's Found Its Way To Consoles From Atari To The Switch

Initially an economical repurpose of failed Radar Scope arcade cabinets, Donkey Kong is one of Nintendo's earliest video games and the origin of the Mario series' aesthetic and gameplay tenets.

Originally coming to arcades in 1981, it was quickly ported to multiple Atari systems and personal Beyond Donkey Kong 64 's 'Frantic Factory' level, and through Animal Crossing 's playable NES' it can be played on a host of Nintendo platforms.

item.title: Elden Ring: Paladin Build Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Armors for Paladin Build in Elden Ring
  • Best Weapons for Paladin Build in Elden Ring
  • Best Spells for Paladin Build
  • Best Talismans for Paladin Build
  • Recommended Stats and Best Starter Class for Paladin Build

The fantasy elements of Souls games like Elden Ring have always been a major point of attraction. FromSoft's captivating Soulsborne games allow you to cosplay as various characters like Mages, Knights, Samurai, and more. Additionally, there are hybrid classes like Paladin and Spellblade, centered around two or more offensive stats.

In this guide, players will find a comprehensive build guide on how to turn their character into a Paladin. When imagining a Paladin, most people think of holy knights wielding heavy swords and using their power to support and heal allies. This Elden Ring Paladin build is exactly that. Continue reading to discover the best armors, weapons, spells, talismans, class, and stats for a Paladin build in Elden Ring .

Best Armors for Paladin Build in Elden Ring

When creating a build in Elden Ring , players should not underestimate fashion, as it best represents the build's theme. A Paladin can be described as a glorified holy knight, and fortunately, there are many armor sets that fit this description in Elden Ring .

  • Solitude Set : Added in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, the Solitude Set quickly became a fan favorite due to its resemblance to Guts' armor from the Berserk series. While this armor set has a grim appearance, it can fit into any knight-like build.
  • Blackflame Monk Set : In the dark and eerie realms of Elden Ring , a Paladin might prefer a mysterious armor set like the Blackflame Monk set. Its dull white appearance and hooded headgear make it stand out. However, farming this set is no easy task, as there are only a few places where you can find Blackflame Monks, who have a low drop rate for the set pieces.
  • Haligtree Knight Set : In Elden Ring , the color gold is depicted as a sign of the Holy. The Haligtree Knight Set features a slight golden tint on its helm and beautiful golden embroidery of Miquella’s Haligtree on its chest piece. In terms of appearance, the Haligtree Knight Set is one of the best armor sets for a Paladin build. Additionally, equipping its helm grants you two points in Faith.
  • Leyndell Knight Set : After the Haligtree Knight Set, the Leyndell Knight Set is the next best choice for a Paladin build. This armor set shares the same design as the Haligtree Knight set but with a stronger golden shade, as it is worn by the knights defending Leyndell, Royal Capital, a city at the Erdtree’s foot bathed in its golden rays.
  • Tree Sentinel Set : Tree Sentinels are some of the iconic enemies in Elden Ring , as you face one right at the start. This enemy is quite literally a knight in golden armor. The armor boasts high poise, and its golden look complements the holy Erdtree incantations.

These are just a few armor sets that work well with a Paladin build theme. Players can find many other amazing sets for their own Paladin builds, such as the Royal Knight Set , Malformed Dragon Set (without the helm), Crucible Axe Set , and Crucible Tree Set .

Best Weapons for Paladin Build in Elden Ring

Elden Ring offers many Holy weapons to complement a Paladin build. With the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, players now have access to several new weapons that scale with Strength and Faith stats. In addition to Holy weapons, there are also some non-unique weapons that can be infused with a Holy affinity by equipping an Ash of War to suit a Strength-Faith build. Here are some weapon suggestions for a Paladin build:

  • Miquellan Knight's Sword or Inseparable Sword : While the Miquellan Knight’s Sword is a straight sword and the Inseparable Sword is a greatsword, both share the Ash of War called Sacred Blade. This skill launches a holy projectile at the enemy and infuses the weapon with a holy aura. If you prefer not to use either of these weapons, you can obtain the Ash of War: Sacred Blade from Limgrave, which is usable on almost all weapon types.
  • Golden Order Greatsword : One of the legendary armaments in Elden Ring , forged by the second Elden Lord, Radagon. This weapon serves as a symbol of the "tenets of the Golden Order." It is arguably the best weapon for a Paladin build in terms of appearance. However, its Ash of War: Establish Order is quite lackluster. Players who prioritize the build’s theme over damage can definitely opt for the Golden Order Greatsword.
  • Euporia : A legendary twinblade available in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, Euporia is one of the strongest Holy weapons. Its unique skill, Euporia Vortex, can be compared to the Comet Azur spell, but instead of a powerful beam of magic, it fires a holy beam. However, you will need to reach the final region of the Elden Ring DLC to obtain this weapon.
  • Ordovis's Greatsword : This weapon features the standard moveset of a Claymore greatsword, but its main source of power comes from its skill, Ordovis’s Vortex. It is one of the most powerful weapons for Strength-Faith builds like a Paladin build. The weapon receives a decent AR boost from investing in Faith, but you will benefit more from Strength investment. If you plan to use the Crucible Axe Set, then the Ordovis’s Greatsword is the obvious choice.
  • Any medium shield of your choice

For Sacred Seals needed for casting incantations, you can choose between the Clawmark Seal or the Erdtree Seal . If your Paladin build has a higher investment in Strength, the Clawmark Seal will offer higher scaling. On the other hand, the Erdtree Seal provides the best scaling from Faith alone.

Best Spells for Paladin Build

One of the best aspects of a hybrid Faith build is the vast number of incantations you gain access to in Elden Ring . With just a little investment in Faith, you can use incantations for healing, raising defenses, and attacking enemies. Here are some of the best spells for a Paladin build:

  • Golden Vow (Requires 25 Faith): One of the best buffs in Elden Ring , Golden Vow increases both damage and damage negation for the character in an area. If you plan to participate in PVP, you can use Golden Vow to buff your allies as well.
  • Blessing's Boon (Requires 24 Faith): A low-Faith-friendly healing incantation that grants around 700 HP over 90 seconds. It can be stacked with the Blessed Dew Talisman for additional healing. While exploring dungeons, you can use this spell instead of drinking a Crimson Flask. If you have more points in Faith, you can opt for a stronger spell like Blessing of the Erdtree or Erdtree Heal .
  • Flame, Grant me Strength (Requires 15 Faith): With a low requirement of only 15 Faith, Flame, Grant Me Strength is too good to ignore in any build involving physical attacks. Faith weapons in a Paladin build also deal a decent amount of physical damage, which is buffed by 20%. Moreover, it is a body buff and can be stacked with Golden Vow.

In addition to these spells, you can also equip offensive incantations like Discus of Light, Triple Rings of Light, or even Catch Flame if needed.

Best Talismans for Paladin Build

  • Sacred Scorpion Charm : This talisman is a must-have for any Holy build in Elden Ring . It increases your Holy damage by 12% but lowers damage negation by 10%. Unlike other Scorpion Charms, the Sacred variant is available quite early. You can obtain it by defeating Anastasia, Tarnished-Eater, near the Smoldering Church at the entrance of Caelid.
  • Shard of Alexander : In a Paladin build, you have access to weapons with strong Ashes of War. Equipping the Shard of Alexander gives a simple 15% boost without any drawbacks. However, you need to progress to the end of Great Jar Alexander’s questline to obtain this talisman.
  • Two-Handed Sword Talisman or Curved Sword Talisman : The Shadow of the Erdtree DLC introduced the versatile Two-Handed Sword Talisman. While two-handing any weapon, this talisman grants a 15% attack increase. However, if you are equipping a shield and using guard counters, the Curved Sword Talisman might be a better choice.
  • Erdtree's Favor +2 or Great-Jar's Arsenal : The fourth talisman slot is a flex slot. Erdtree’s Favor +2 is a generic pick for all builds due to its HP, Stamina, and Equip Load boost. But if you have equipped a heavy armor set and are wielding a heavy weapon, then opt for Great-Jar’s Arsenal to maintain a medium roll.

Recommended Stats and Best Starter Class for Paladin Build

For a Paladin build, your primary stats will be Strength and Faith, but you will also need to level up Vigor and Endurance to survive in Elden Ring and equip the best gear. When picking a starter class, look for one with high Strength or Faith. Confessor and Prophet are both excellent starting classes for a Paladin build.

Here is a level 125 stats recommendation for a Paladin build with the Confessor starter class:

  • Vigor: 40
  • Mind: 14
  • Endurance: 30
  • Strength: 60
  • Dexterity: 12
  • Intelligence: 9
  • Faith: 30
  • Arcane: 9

Beyond level 125, you will want to invest more points into Vigor or level up other stats needed to wield your preferred weapons. But if you already meet the weapon stat requirements and are satisfied with your HP pool, invest your runes into Faith to unlock more incantations and boost Holy damage from weapons.

item.title: 10 Best Games in Established Fictional Settings, Ranked
item.description:
Game developers face many decisions when creating a new game, from mechanics to characters and how they fit into the title's story. Another crucial choice is selecting the universe where the narrative will unfold, ensuring the environment complements the game's other elements.

While many companies excel at building worlds from scratch, populating them with events that fit perfectly with the game's theme, others prefer to use pre-established settings. This approach allows them to create epic stories in familiar environments, with many games standing out in this category.

10 Call Of Cthulhu

Lovecraftian Myths Are Found In Various Places

The mythology created by H.P. Lovecraft has inspired many works in pop culture, and video games are no exception. While many games build their own universes based on the author's myths, others are more direct, such as the 2018 Call of Cthulhu , which offers a psychological horror and investigative experience.

In the role of Edward Pierce, a private detective called to investigate a family's mysterious death on Darkwater Island, players are drawn into a classic Lovecraftian tale. The game's atmosphere is particularly noteworthy, as it delves into themes of mysticism and the fear of the unknown while horrors that defy reality emerge.

9 Middle-Earth: Shadow Of Mordor

Exploring More Of Lord Of The Rings Lore

The Lord of the Rings is one of the most incredible universes ever created, inspiring various films and series adaptations, as well as being a fertile ground for video games. While many games are indirectly inspired by Tolkien's world, others, like Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor , are direct adaptations.

In the game, players take on the role of Talion, a ranger of Gondor guarding Mordor as Sauron begins to regain power. Shadow of Mordor also delves into the origins of the Rings of Power and is known for its Nemesis system, where enemies remember past encounters and grow stronger based on previous interactions.

8 Shadowrun Returns

Magic And Technology Meet In An RPG Setting

While Cyberpunk 2077 focuses on a dystopian future dominated by technology, Shadowrun Returns blends these elements with high fantasy. Inspired by the tabletop RPG of the same name, this world sees the resurgence of magic, where creatures like elves and orcs coexist with humans, cybernetic implants, and mega-corporations.

Playing as a shadowrunner, the player receives a posthumous message from Sam Watts, an old ally, leading to a dark investigation in Seattle. The narrative reveals a serial killer and a conspiracy involving dimensional spirits. The choices made along the way shape the story, offering a deep and complex experience typical of the Shadowrun universe.

7 Warhammer 40,000 Rogue Trader

Warhammer Is One Of The Largest Universes Ever Created

Created in 1983, Warhammer is one of the most recognized universes among wargame enthusiasts, largely because it helped establish the hobby. Following its popularity, various video games have been produced, with Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader being a notable option for CRPG fans.

The game, developed by Owlcat, takes players on a journey through the Koronus Expanse, a largely unmapped but highly dangerous region of space. This journey introduces the different factions inhabiting the setting and the conflicts between them, all while leaving much of the Warhammer universe's vast narrative unexplored.

6 Pathfinder Kingmaker

Golarion Has Its Own Unique Charm

Pathfinder and Dungeons & Dragons share many similarities, one of which is their expansion into the realm of video games. Pathfinder: Kingmaker , inspired by the Adventure Path of the same name, is a cRPG that takes players on a journey through the River Kingdoms of Golarion.

This adventure tasks players with navigating the politics and challenges of the region as they take on the responsibility of colonizing an area known as the Greenbelt. However, the neighboring kingdoms have their own interests, and ancient dangers frequently threaten the area, making it even more difficult for the new rulers to develop their lands.

5 Hogwarts Legacy

The Harry Potter Universe Is Well-Known

Since the success of the Harry Potter books and films, fans have eagerly awaited a game that transcends mere retellings of familiar stories. After much anticipation, Hogwarts Legacy fulfilled this wish by taking players on a new adventure in the Wizarding World.

Set in the late 1800s, the game expands the Harry Potter universe by allowing free exploration of not just Hogwarts Castle but also its surroundings. Players interact with various characters, and despite taking place centuries before the books, the game includes important families like the Weasleys, Blacks, and Gaunt.

4 Star Wars Jedi Fallen Order

Cal Kestis Is One Of The Many Survivors Of Order 66

Though many games delve into the expansive Star Wars universe, Jedi Fallen Order stands out for presenting an original story set in a well-known period of the films. Taking place after the events of Order 66, the game follows Cal Kestis, a young Jedi on the run, trying to survive the Empire's persecution.

The game immerses players in one of the galaxy's darkest periods as Cal seeks to rebuild the Jedi Order. Despite being set in a thoroughly explored universe, Jedi Fallen Order introduces new characters and narratives, offering a fresh and engaging experience for fans of the franchise.

3 Cyberpunk 2077

No Happy Endings In Night City

Conceived by Mike Pondsmith before being adapted into a game by CD Projekt Red, Cyberpunk began as a tabletop RPG, thrusting players into a dystopian future where mega-corporations dominate everyday life. Iconic figures like Johnny Silverhand and the Arasaka Corporation originated in these RPG books.

The video game Cyberpunk 2077 takes place several decades after the events covered in the original RPG, introducing new developments in Night City while retaining the setting's core essence. Before taking on Keanu Reeves' likeness in the game, Johnny Silverhand was inspired by David Bowie.

2 Baldur’s Gate 3

Only A Small Part Of A Vast Universe

Inspired by one of the main settings of Dungeons & Dragons , the Forgotten Realms, Baldur’s Gate 3 presents just a fraction of what tabletop RPG fans can experience when venturing into this richly diverse world. Faerûn, as it's known, offers a vast and varied environment.

The Forgotten Realms also feature other iconic cities like Neverwinter, previously the focus of other games, and Waterdeep, where Gale, one of the main characters in Baldur’s Gate 3 , once lived. Beyond the games, numerous books and novels further expand the setting, offering players even more insight into this extensive universe.

1 The Witcher 3 Wild Hunt

A Marvelous Continuation Of Andrzej Sapkowski’s Books

The Witcher trilogy, developed by CD Projekt Red, stands out for exploring an established universe without creating new characters or directly adapting the books' stories. Instead, the series continues the saga of iconic figures like Geralt of Rivia, Yennefer, and Ciri, adding unique and authentic chapters to their journeys.

Rather than building a new world from scratch, the developers chose to follow the existing narrative, offering fans the chance to experience new adventures with familiar characters. Each game in the trilogy adds new chapters to the protagonists' stories, respecting the original material while innovating in its continuity.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Players Think One Change Would Make Clash Better
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Overwatch 2 Season 12 introduces new Support hero Juno and Clash mode, but players criticize the mode for flawed point distribution.
  • Content creator Kevin Walker praises recent improvements to Clash mode, but highlights issues with defending teams gaining easy points.
  • Suggestions to address Clash mode flaws include not awarding points to defenders on retakes and increasing point rewards for attackers.

Some players of the new Overwatch 2 Clash mode are voicing their complaints about what they see as a frustrating match flow, and are also making suggestions aimed at fixing it. Clash mode debuted in Overwatch 2 with the launch of Season 12 on August 20, 2024.

Overwatch 2 is seeing a new surge of activity as players old and new flood in to try out the new content that launched with Season 12. Chief among the new offerings is the Overwatch 2 Support hero Juno, the game's newest playable character. The Martian astronaut is also joined by a new game mode called Clash, which involves teams struggling to capture a series of control points along a mirrored map.

Unfortunately, players are complaining about Clash, saying the mode is host to frustrating flaws related to the way points are distributed to teams for taking capture points. According to commentators like streamer Kevin Walker, flaws in the point distribution method contribute to too many "anticlimactic" Clash matches in Overwatch 2 .

Players Call Overwatch 2 Clash Matches 'Anticlimactic' Due To Point Flaws

In a tweet on the subject, Walker praised recent improvements to Clash mode from its earlier trial runs, such as adjustments to the point distribution for attackers capturing the last node. However, he opposed the system awarding a point to defenders for capturing the locations closest to their respective spawn point, because Overwatch 2 Clash map design heavily favors defending teams when close to a team spawn. As a result, too many matches have an attacking team mounting an exciting comeback end up losing because the defenders retake their final spawn to win on points. For viewers, the dynamic is anticlimactic, and can even feel "undeserved" for the winners.

Walker suggested that, at a minimum, Clash mode should be adjusted not to award a point on retake to defenders when under match point conditions. Such a change would prevent less exciting victories and preserve the drama of a comeback win for attackers. Other players on communities like the Competitive Overwatch subreddit suggested an alternative solution, like increasing the point rewards for attackers and increasing the overall victory threshold to 6 or 7 points. This solution would pressure defenders to push back harder when fending off a reversal.

Blizzard has rekindled excitement for its landmark hero shooter, as players try out all the new additions for Overwatch 2 Season 12. Besides the arrival of Juno, many players are trying out Clash, which strongly resembles the beloved (if unbalanced) Assault mode from the original game. The recently highlighted flaws in Clash could dampen some of that excitement, though, so it could be in Blizzard and the community's interest to address the most urgent complaints about the new mode.
